flawed_nl_solution:
One-third of her bonus was $900/3 = $<<900/3=3000>>3000.
After one year, stock A doubled in value and was worth $3000*2 = $<<3000*2=6000>>6000.
After one year, stock B doubled in value and was worth $3000*2 = $<<3000*2=6000>>6000.
After one year, stock C had lost half its value and was worth $3000/2 = $<<3000/2=1500>>1500.
Altogether, at the end of the year, Gwen's stocks were worth $6000+$6000+$1500 = $<<6000+6000+1500=13500>>13500
#### 13500

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 300, not 3000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
